parsed.internal_thinking: I have already secured Node 12, which gives me a strong start with Wood (3), Brick (6), and Sheep (4). My primary objective for this second placement is to secure the remaining two resources, Wheat and Ore, to ensure I'm not dependent on trading early in the game. Looking at the board, Node 25 is an excellent choice. It provides Wheat on an 8 (5 pips), Ore on a 3 (2 pips), and additional Sheep on a 4 (3 pips). This totals 10 pips and completes my resource spread perfectly. Node 24 is also an option, but Node 25's proximity to the Ore port (Node 26) and the high probability of the 8-Wheat makes it slightly more attractive for a long-term strategy involving cities and development cards. Alice and Bob have taken some strong interior spots, so securing this coastal position with high-value numbers is a solid move. I'll place my settlement on Node 25 and then look to build a road towards the Ore port or back towards my first settlement to eventually compete for the Longest Road. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: I've secured all five resources. Node 25 gives me a strong 8-Wheat and 3-Ore. My next goal is to upgrade Node 25 or 12 to a city as soon as possible to maximize my high-pip yields (6-Brick and 8-Wheat). I should also monitor Alice's expansion toward the north and Bob's progress on the Ore/Wheat hexes in the south.
parsed.say_outloud: Great starts, everyone! I'm going to round out my resources by taking Node 25. That 8-Wheat looks too good to pass up, and it'll give me a bit of everything to work with. Good luck with the rest of your setups!
